feedback.detail: Standard querySelector cannot penetrate shadow boundaries - pageFunction with shadowRoot property is the correct approach

feedback.title: JavaScript dialogs (alert, confirm, prompt) are automatically handled by cdp-ski
feedback.detail: JavaScript dialogs (alert, confirm, prompt) are automatically handled by cdp-skill's dialog handler without requiring any special steps or workarounds

feedback.title: The dialog handler defaults to accepting all dialogs and entering 'Hello CDP' fo
feedback.detail: The dialog handler defaults to accepting all dialogs and entering 'Hello CDP' for prompts, which matches the test requirements exactly

feedback.title: The first click (JS Alert button) unexpectedly reported a new tab opened (t207,
feedback.detail: The first click (JS Alert button) unexpectedly reported a new tab opened (t207, demoqa.com/progress-bar) which is not related to this test. This appears to be a spurious tab detection issue.

feedback.title: The result text in #result paragraph updates correctly after each dialog interac
feedback.detail: The result text in #result paragraph updates correctly after each dialog interaction, making milestone verification straightforward

feedback.title: No native file upload support in cdp-skill
feedback.detail: The skill lacks a built-in step for uploading files to file input elements. File uploads require CDP's DOM.setFileInputFiles or Input.setFileInputFiles command, but this is not exposed as a step.

feedback.title: First milestone checks upload page elements that disappear after upload
feedback.detail: Milestone 'upload_area_present' (weight 0.15) checks for elements that only exist on the upload page (#drag-drop-upload or #file-upload). After successful upload and navigation to the confirmation page, these elements are no longer present, causing the milestone to fail even though the test succeeded.

feedback.title: Element ref [ref=s1e1] failed to resolve even though the snapshot showed it exis
feedback.detail: Element ref [ref=s1e1] failed to resolve even though the snapshot showed it exists. The ref appeared in viewportSnapshot but click with ref selector returned 'Element not found'. Fallback to direct CSS selector 'button' succeeded immediately.

feedback.title: Clicking the Start button opened an unexpected new tab to https://www.saucedemo.
feedback.detail: Clicking the Start button opened an unexpected new tab to https://www.saucedemo.com/ (t208). This is not related to the test task but was reported in the CLI output.

feedback.title: Both date pickers successfully configured using calendar UI controls
feedback.detail: Both date pickers successfully configured using calendar UI controls

feedback.title: First date picker uses month/year dropdowns for navigation
feedback.detail: First date picker uses month/year dropdowns for navigation

feedback.title: Second date/time picker uses Previous/Next month buttons and scrollable time lis
feedback.detail: Second date/time picker uses Previous/Next month buttons and scrollable time list

feedback.title: Calendar pickers automatically closed after date/time selection
feedback.detail: Calendar pickers automatically closed after date/time selection

feedback.title: JSON escaping in echo commands is error-prone for complex pageFunction expressio
feedback.detail: JSON escaping in echo commands is error-prone for complex pageFunction expressions. File-based input (cat file.json | cdp-skill) works reliably but adds overhead. Consider adding a --expression flag that reads from stdin without JSON parsing.

feedback.title: First attempt to select 'Group 2, option 1' appeared to click the option but the
feedback.detail: First attempt to select 'Group 2, option 1' appeared to click the option but the value didn't persist (placeholder still showing). Re-opening the dropdown and selecting again worked. This may be a timing issue with React Select's onChange handlers.

feedback.title: The Old Style Select Menu screenshot shows 'White' visually but the DOM value is
feedback.detail: The Old Style Select Menu screenshot shows 'White' visually but the DOM value is correctly '6' (Purple). This is a display-vs-value discrepancy in the screenshot or the webpage itself, not a cdp-skill issue.

feedback.title: SKILL.md could benefit from a 'Complex Selectors' section showing how to work wi
feedback.detail: SKILL.md could benefit from a 'Complex Selectors' section showing how to work with React Select components: (1) click container to open, (2) wait for options to appear, (3) click specific option by ID. The current troubleshooting section doesn't cover custom dropdown widgets.

feedback.title: Element ref [ref=s1e3] failed to resolve on click, despite being present in the
feedback.detail: Element ref [ref=s1e3] failed to resolve on click, despite being present in the snapshot. Had to fall back to CSS selector #startStopButton.

feedback.title: Progress bar timing test successful. Monitoring approach: polled progress value
feedback.detail: Progress bar timing test successful. Monitoring approach: polled progress value 5 times over ~6 seconds, clicked Stop when value reached 28%, final value was 38% (within 25-50% target).

feedback.title: CaptureVerification.js failed with 'Uncaught' error when attempting to capture v
feedback.detail: CaptureVerification.js failed with 'Uncaught' error when attempting to capture verification snapshot. Trace written without verificationSnapshot field.

feedback.title: Auto-forced click fallback used twice (steps 7, 8, 10). CDP click intercepted by
feedback.detail: Auto-forced click fallback used twice (steps 7, 8, 10). CDP click intercepted by overlay or animation.

feedback.title: Fill step failed with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' error when form fields
feedback.detail: Fill step failed with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' error when form fields were below viewport.

feedback.title: All 4 milestones verified: on_checkout_overview, onesie_in_order, bike_light_in_
feedback.detail: All 4 milestones verified: on_checkout_overview, onesie_in_order, bike_light_in_order, subtotal_correct. Total amount $17.98 correctly calculated from two items.

feedback.title: Fill fails with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' when element scrolled offscreen
feedback.detail: Fill step targeting [data-test="firstName"] failed because element was scrolled below viewport (scroll y=208, 100%). Had to scroll to top first. The fill command should auto-scroll or report clearer error.

feedback.title: CDP click fallback to jsClick-auto
feedback.detail: Multiple clicks required jsClick-auto fallback (add-to-cart, cart link, checkout, continue, finish). Site profile noted this is expected for saucedemo React buttons.

feedback.title: Header search button required click to focus
feedback.detail: On allrecipes.com, the search input[name=q] is hidden in a fullscreen nav overlay. Clicking the search button in header opens it and focuses the input. Site profile mentioned 'textbox name=q' but didn't clarify it requires opening via button click first.

feedback.title: jsClick-auto fallback used frequently
feedback.detail: Multiple clicks triggered 'CDP click was intercepted, used JavaScript click fallback'. This happened on both the search button and recipe card links.

feedback.title: Default drag method may not work for HTML5 drag-and-drop
feedback.detail: The default 'auto' drag method chose 'mouse-events' which did not trigger the HTML5 drag and drop handlers. Had to explicitly use 'method: html5' to make the swap work. Consider improving auto-detection to check for draggable attribute or HTML5 DnD event handlers.

feedback.title: Ref not found after hover reveals element
feedback.detail: After hovering to reveal a hidden element (View profile link), the ref [ref=s1e2] shown in the changes.added array was not found when used in a subsequent click step. The ref appeared in the viewportSnapshot but could not be resolved. Workaround: use text selector instead of ref.

feedback.title: Refs from viewportSnapshot become stale immediately on complex pages
feedback.detail: On Wikipedia article pages, refs shown in the viewportSnapshot (like s1e17, s1e27) fail with 'Element not found' when used in click commands. Taking a fresh snapshot and using CSS selectors or text-based clicking works. This appears related to the page complexity or dynamic rendering.

feedback.title: Use text-based clicking instead of refs on Wikipedia
feedback.detail: When clicking links on Wikipedia article pages, using {"click": {"text": "Link text"}} is more reliable than using refs from the snapshot. The text-based approach with jsClick-fallback method succeeded where ref-based clicking failed.

feedback.title: OneTrust cookie modal blocks clicks without force option
feedback.detail: The 'About Your Privacy' modal from OneTrust blocks clicks on underlying content. The modal elements are not exposed in the accessibility tree, requiring force:true to bypass. The #onetrust-accept-btn-handler selector does not work to dismiss the modal.

feedback.title: First click on live updates article required navigating back
feedback.detail: The top featured article was a 'live updates' link (apnews.com/live/...) rather than a regular article (apnews.com/article/...). Had to navigate back and click on a different article to match the milestone URL pattern.

feedback.title: archive.org SPA does not hydrate in headless mode
feedback.detail: The archive.org homepage uses an Angular-style <app-root> component that requires JavaScript to render content. In headless mode, the content did not hydrate, leaving only the noscript fallback. Navigating directly to web.archive.org worked as expected.

feedback.title: Click timeout despite successful navigation
feedback.detail: Click on the snapshot date link (ref s1e116) timed out after 30s but navigation to the archived page completed successfully. The step reported an error even though the outcome was achieved.

feedback.title: TinyMCE API rate limited - editor read-only
feedback.detail: The TinyMCE WYSIWYG editor on the-internet.herokuapp.com is in read-only mode due to Tiny Cloud API limits. Direct DOM manipulation via pageFunction inside the iframe was required to set the content, bypassing the editor's read-only state.

feedback.title: Checkbox visibility warning
feedback.detail: TodoMVC checkbox elements are hidden but clickable - first click attempt showed warning 'Element ref:s1e3 exists but is not visible' but force:true worked. The checkbox input elements have opacity:0 CSS style.

feedback.title: Frame milestone verification requires context awareness
feedback.detail: The middle_frame_content milestone only passes when verified from frame-top context, not from main frame context. The milestone eval_truthy checks direct child frames, but MIDDLE is nested inside frame-top. Consider updating milestones to search recursively or specify the expected frame context for verification.

feedback.title: upload_area_present milestone fails on success page
feedback.detail: The milestone verifies existence of #drag-drop-upload or #file-upload elements, but these elements only exist on the initial upload page. After successful form submission, the page navigates to a success page that lacks these elements. The milestone should either check for these on initial load OR be rewritten to verify that upload WAS present (past tense) by checking the success state.

feedback.title: fill with selector [data-test="firstName"] failed with 'Coordinates must be non-
feedback.detail: fill with selector [data-test="firstName"] failed with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' when page was scrolled to bottom - had to scroll to top first

feedback.title: Click on ref f0s1e55 (expected Continue button) triggered burger menu instead -
feedback.detail: Click on ref f0s1e55 (expected Continue button) triggered burger menu instead - ref targeting may have been ambiguous

feedback.title: BBC uses cross-origin consent iframe (privacy-mgmt.com) that cannot be directly
feedback.detail: BBC uses cross-origin consent iframe (privacy-mgmt.com) that cannot be directly interacted with. Required JavaScript removal workaround.

feedback.title: Search input on allrecipes.com homepage (input[name=q]) does not trigger navigat
feedback.detail: Search input on allrecipes.com homepage (input[name=q]) does not trigger navigation on Enter press. Had to use direct URL navigation to search results.

feedback.title: Default drag method (mouse-events) does not work for HTML5 drag-and-drop interfa
feedback.detail: Default drag method (mouse-events) does not work for HTML5 drag-and-drop interfaces. The 'html5' method must be specified explicitly for sites using HTML5 DnD API.

feedback.title: archive.org main page SPA (app-root) does not render in headless Chrome - naviga
feedback.detail: archive.org main page SPA (app-root) does not render in headless Chrome - navigate directly to web.archive.org instead

feedback.title: Page uses nested framesets: main frame contains frame-top and frame-bottom at de
feedback.detail: Page uses nested framesets: main frame contains frame-top and frame-bottom at depth 1

feedback.title: frame-top contains three nested frames at depth 2: frame-left, frame-middle, fra
feedback.detail: frame-top contains three nested frames at depth 2: frame-left, frame-middle, frame-right

feedback.title: Successfully read all four frame contents: LEFT, MIDDLE, RIGHT, BOTTOM
feedback.detail: Successfully read all four frame contents: LEFT, MIDDLE, RIGHT, BOTTOM

feedback.title: Frame switching by name works correctly with the frame step
feedback.detail: Frame switching by name works correctly with the frame step

feedback.title: Must switch to main frame (frame='top') before switching between sibling frames
feedback.detail: Must switch to main frame (frame='top') before switching between sibling frames
